meanings.sent1: She was squegging the clay to make a small sculpture.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys squegging his stress ball during meetings.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were squegging each other in a friendly wrestling match.
meanings.sent4: The suitcase was so full that it felt like it was squegging all his clothes.
meanings.sent5: The python was squegging its prey in its powerful coils.

meanings.definition: The act of making a squelching or squishing sound.
meanings.sent1: The squegging of the mud under his boots could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: The chef loved the satisfying squegging noise when he kneaded the dough.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character's squegging footsteps added a comical touch to the scene.
meanings.sent4: The old car's brakes made a squegging sound every time it stopped.
meanings.sent5: The child giggled at the squegging of the bubble wrap as he popped the bubbles.

meanings.sent1: Their squegging during the game showed their close friendship.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's tail wagging was a sign of its squegging with the kitten.
meanings.sent3: The siblings engaged in squegging as they playfully teased each other.
meanings.sent4: The students erupted in laughter at the teacher's squegging of a classmate.
meanings.sent5: The playful squegging between the two friends always brought smiles to their faces.
